page.title: 16PANTASAPH'S WHITE QUARRIES
page.content: Recent years have seen a struggle to prevent the re-opening of the "White Quarries" at Pantasaph. After years of neglect,{nature had reclaimed the site as a sheltered habitat harbouring many interesting species of plant including wild orchids, cowslips, foxgloves and a mixture of hawthorn,ash and sycamore trees.Rabbits,badgers and foxes are to be seen.Footpaths crossed the area, which was used as a picnic spot and a natural playground by children.Despite the campaign by the "White Quarries Association" conservation group,the first preparatory work on the{re-open- {ing of the quarry,}to crush limestone for industrial chemicals,began in 1985 Heavy lorries,blasting and crushing machinery causing plumes of dust will soon{shatter the tranquility}of the Franciscan Friars at the Monastery and local residents.
